REMAINING TIRES ON VEHICLE ARE SAME MAKE/MANUFACTURE AS THE ONE IN QUESTION.*AK

PHOTOGRAPHS HAVE BEEN TAKEN OF TIRE AND TREAD (TREAD WAS RETRIEVED FROM FREEWAY FOR INSPECTION).  ALSO, SAID FAILURE CAUSED COSMETIC DAMGE TO FRONT FENDER AND HEADLIGHT.  OF WHICH, PHOTOGRAPHIC EVIDENCE ALSO HAS BEEN TAKEN.*AK (DOT NUMBER: HYHB3U6206  TIRESIZE: P215/75R14)
WHILE PARKING VEHICLE OVERNIGNT FUEL WAS LEAKING FROM FUEL TANK.  *AK
VEHICLE STARTED ON ITS OWN AND COLLIDED WITH ANOTHER VEHICLE.

AFTER PARKING VEHICLE, TURNING ENGINE OFF AND PUTTING ON PARKING BRAKE; WITHIN 45 MINUTE OR MORE, LEARNED THAT VEHICLE STARTED BY  ITSELF AND CRASHED  INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE. VEHICLE OPERATION WAS WITNESSED BY A VALET AND A POLICEMAN. DEALER/MANUFACTURER NOTIFIED.*AK

WHY DO CAR MANUFACTURES HAVE TO HELP PEOPLE USE TOBACCO BY PROVIDING ASHTRAYS IN THE CARS.  THIS SEEMS LIKE AN ANTI-TRUST ISSUE.  *AK  *MR   *NLM    **DIMSII IVOQ ENTRY POSTED AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS*740948
BROKEN BLEED VALVE STEM RESULTING IN LEAKAGE.

FORD, 1967 MUSTANG,  SIX CYL AUTO TRANS.  WHILE I WAS STOPPED FOR A LIGHT,  THE CARBURETOR RETURN SPRING LET GO.  LUCKY FOR ME, I HAD MY FOOT ON THE BRAKE AND OFF THE GAS PEDAL AS I WAS STILL IN DRIVE.  I HEARD THE SPRING BOUNCE OFF THE FAN AND THE ENGINE SPEED UP. I SHUT OFF THE ENGINE, TOOK THE  SHIFT OUT OF DRIVE AND COASTED TO THE CURB.. I COULD NOT FIND ANY PART OF THE SPRING OR ANCHOR POINT.    I TOOK A SPRING OUT FROM UNDER THE PASSENGER SEAT AND USED THAT ARRANGEMENT FOR A NUMBER OF YEARS.  I STILL HAVE THE CAR IN THE GARAGE BUT HAVE NOT USED IT FOR ABOUT 30 YEARS.    AT THE TIME THERE WERE A NUMBER OF INCIDENTS WHERE THESE MUSTANGS SPED UP OUT OF CONTROL, WITH SERIOUS CONSEQUENCES.    FORD WOULD NOT OWN UP TO THE PROBLEM.  I HAD GONE TO FORD ASKING FOR REPLACEMENT PARTS, BUT NO RESPONSE.  I HAD WRITTEN TO NTSB A NUMBER OF YEARS AGO, BUT NO RESPONSE THERE EITHER.    STATUE OF LIMITATIONS HAS MOST LIKELY RUN OUT FOR REPARATIONS TO THE ACCIDENT VICTIMS.    OF COURSE THE PROBLEM WAS EVENTUALLY RECOGNIZED WITHOUT HONOR TO THE VICTIMS AND THE TENSION SPRINGS REPLACED BY A SERIES OF COMPRESSION SPRINGS ON LATER MODELS THEREAFTER.    NEVER HAVE RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE BY FORD. *TR
FALSE READING FROM GAS GAUGE GIVES AN ILLUSION OF MORE FUEL THAN ACTUALLY PRESENT IN THE FUEL TANK. *AK
WHILE VEHICLE WAS IN GARAGE BATTERY EXPLODED. THERE WAS DAMAGE TO  HOOD, AND ACID INSIDE VEHICLE ON FLOOR OF GARAGE. DEALER REPLACED BATTERY.  *AK

HOSPITAL HAS RECEIVED NUMEROUS CAR SAFETY SEATS TO DISTRIBUTE TO PATIENTS THAT ARE MISSING A LOCKING CLIP OR BELT LOCK OFF DEVICE AND THE OWNERS MANUAL IS INCOMPLETE AND HAS NO INSTRUCTIONS FOR INSTALLATION IN A SEAT THAT NEEDS A LOCKING CLIP

I PURCHASED LOWER CONTROL ARM BUSHINGS FOR A 1967 PLYMOUTH BARRACUDA.  THE INNER SLEEVE IS OUT OF SPECIFICATION AND DOES NOT HAVE A PRESS FIT TO THE STUB SHAFT.  THIS IS A DESIGN FLAW AND COULD RESULT IN LOWER CONTROL ARM SEPARATION IN CASE OF A TORSION BAR FAILURE.  THE MANUFACTURER IS CONI SEAL AND THE PARTS ARE IMPORTED FROM TURKEY.  THE MOOG SPEC ON THIS INNER DIAMETER IS 0.813" WHEREAS THE CONI SEAL PART IS 0.825".  THE PART NUMBER IS XK791.  *TR
